meanings.sent1: The madcap rushed into the street without looking both ways.
meanings.sent2: The town always had a few madcaps who would try anything daring.
meanings.sent3: The madcap decided to climb the tree in the park just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her brother was a madcap, always taking risks without thinking.
meanings.sent5: The madcap's impulsiveness often led to trouble.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a wildly unconventional manner
meanings.sent1: She had a madcap idea to paint her room in bright neon colors.
meanings.sent2: The madcap artist shocked the critics with his avant-garde work.
meanings.sent3: The madcap dance routine was a hit at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: His madcap fashion sense turned heads wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The madcap party was unlike anything the town had ever seen.

meanings.definition: Characterized by frivolity and lack of seriousness
meanings.sent1: The madcap comedy had the audience laughing non-stop.
meanings.sent2: Her madcap personality made her the life of the party.
meanings.sent3: The madcap picnic turned into a water balloon fight.
meanings.sent4: The madcap atmosphere of the carnival was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The madcap behavior of the children brightened up the room.
